PREVIOUS QUESTIONS

6.30.22  9:07 pm   is math art or is art math?

      everything is marth

6.30.22  8:51 pm   Do you think that there's a tempo middle ground where you could feel the time signature of a song as being either a "fast 3/4" or a "slow 6/8"?

     sure. people get 3 (or 6) feels mixed up all the time. one of the hazards of putting out a song with any kind of meter divisible by 3, is that some people are gonna always hear it the wrong way from what you meant. this pretty much doesn't happen with 4, because there's only 1 prime factor i guess is what it boils down to

      Or do you think that 3/4 and 6/8 each have a unique enough feel that a 3/4 song would still feel like 3/4 even if you bump the tempo way up, and a 6/8 song would still feel like 6/8 even if you drop the tempo way down?

     people may even disagree about what to put on the page. i see "3/4" written all the time when the quarter note is at many hundreds of bpms. on the other hand, often i'd see 4/4 in the same situation, using triplets and then the quarter note bpm would be extremely slow. for that, i usually prefer to compromise and write it in 6, to adhere to a good size bar length. i generally try to keep the bars as close to 3 seconds as i can, to avoid feeling disoriented

6.30.22  7:27 pm   have you ever tried a "semi-weighted" keyboard?

     i don't recall

     not the 88-key piano-esque ones, but the keys that are just like normal synth keys , but slightly heavier.
i know you prefer unweighted, but i'm just curious if you've every tried the in-between type.

     the top 2 things i like about my keyboard is: the way the keys feel, and how light it is to carry. so if a semi-weighted keyboard can feel exactly the same as that while also not being any heavier, AND there is some additional advantage, then i'm sold
